Industry and art: Paulinho and Coutinho represent two aspects of the game from which Barcelona would surely benefit. One is already on board, while the Catalans are gearing up for a final offensive on Friday to twist Liverpool's arm and force the sale they so dearly desire. In the Brazil pair, they will have a base in midfield that has been sorely lacking in recent years.

Paulinho's set-piece prowess in particular can only enthuse a team that is historically inept, Messi's free-kick bombs notwithstanding, at inventing goals from dead-ball situations. While it may be premature to say the Brazilian could prove their answer to Sergio 'Last Minute' Ramos, he is another weapon in an armoury that has become severely limited in range.

Xavi: "The difference being Real and Barça is that when things go badly for Real Madrid, the players, the staff and management are one."
Xavi: "Be patient, when we won the treble Real Madrid had won I don't know how many consecutive games, it takes patience."
Xavi: "In this club the players must be happy, with Laporta, it is difficult to be a player of Barça."
Xavi: "If Real Madrid signed Paulinho there wouldn't have been criticism. Paulinho made me suffer in the Confederations Cup."
Xavi: "I do not know the leaders of today, but I'd not like to see Barça to play in another way."
Xavi: "I'm no longer at Barça but when they lose I feel very bad."
Xavi: "Neymar was not happy at Barça, he accepted a good offer, Neymar will be the man of PSG."
Xavi: "Messi makes the best out of every player, with me as well."
Xavi: "Cristiano Ronaldo is amazing, a historic footballer, but Messi is second to none."
Xavi: "Messi is an example for the sport football."
Xavi: "Messi is smart, he has a lot of humility, it's simple, if he is happy there is no problem."
Xavi: "I don't think that Messi has not signed his extension to wait for signings."
Xavi: "I like Valverde, he is perfect for the club, he has clear ideas."
Xavi: "At this moment I can't train Barça. I like to take my time."
Xavi: "Iniesta to the Qatar? "If he wants to change air I would recommend it him, but he has 2 or 3 years at high level left."
Xavi: "My philosophy? With Cruyff, you got the ball, how to defend? By keeping the ball."

Soler: "There will be no resignations, Decisions will be made only when we fail to do something. We haven't failed."

Soler on Coutinho: "After weeks of offers, yesterday Liverpool wanted €200 million for one player. We won't put the club at risk."

Soler on Messi's new deal: "Announcement comes after agreement is signed off by both parties. Only thing missing is this formal act."

Soler on Neymar: "The fact he activated a clause unilaterally and left for €222m caused everyone to know that we had money."

Soler on Neymar: "The rumours started at the end of July. Both the President & I didn't know he'd leave prior to that."

Soler: "I have a message that tells me PSG wanted Neymar on July 19. Luckily, WhatsApps have dates. Not in January or March, on July 19."

Soler on no-confidence vote: "Members are entitled to their opinions. What I'll say is that stock should be taken at end of the season."

Robert Fernandez: "We're going to talk about all our moves, the work & planning that we've done. Our work has taken a long time to do."

Robert on Deulofeu: "Raised at La Masia, we saw his displays at Everton and Milan & all agreed to bring him back. Big hopes for him."

Robert on Semedo: "A priority to sign a RB with pace & technique, so we chose Nelson. Coach liked him too, so we worked hard on him."

Robert on Paulinho: "Always tracked progress at Guangzhou. Not true that he lacks quality, he has experience & will change opinions."

Robert on Marlon, Douglas, Samper & Munir being loaned out: "We're confident that several of them can grow this season and come back."

Robert on Vermaelen: "Didn't get many minutes at Roma but has lot of quality. We have a lot of faith in him. Coach very happy with him."

【點解巴塞咁想搞古天奴？點解利物浦點都唔賣？】#長文必讀 #KopEnd翻譯組

熟悉利物浦嘅《獨立報》記者 Simon Hughes，幾日前寫咗篇文，分析點解巴塞死都要咬住古天奴唔放，原來巴塞隆拿總監 Pep Segura 同利物浦老闆 John W.Henry，之前已有過節！（原本星期五已經譯好，但個 browser 死咗成篇文冇晒...要由頭譯過...淚）

事件要回帶到 2012 年，現任巴塞隆拿總監 Pep Segura 當時效職利物浦，擔任青訓總監。當時利物浦剛辭退體育總監 Damien Comolli 不久，John W. Henry 曾邀請 Pep Segura 升職，任體育總監。但當羅渣士上任後，事件卻不了了之（陳公按：有消息指 FSG 當年已一心任命 Segura 為體育總監，但羅渣士在任命記者會上打「開口牌」，在 FSG 不知情下表明不會接受於體育總監下工作，打亂的 FSG 原有計劃，亦衍生日後 transfer committee 的誕生，詳情要留待開節目再講）。Segura 在打算開展球季工作時，才發現新球季自己不在球會計劃內，便嘗試找尋 John W. Henry 尋找答案，但並沒有得到回應。結果，在 2012 年 7 月季前準備開始的一天，Segura 便辭職離開利物浦。

Simon Hughes 的報導指，Segura 並未忘記這樁事件，雖然巴塞隆拿的確視古天奴為長遠取代恩斯尼達的人物，但對 Segura 來說，收購古天奴卻不單只是競技原因，而是希望破壞 FSG 早前表面古天奴會留隊的承諾。報導指，細心看早前聲稱古天奴留隊的聲明，發出單位並不是利物浦，而是 Fenway Sports Group，而且並不是一般球會聲明般有簽署的。 Simon Hughes 表示，一般球會日常決定，是由高普，體育總監愛華士及 FSG 主席哥頓負責的，但今次不放售古天奴的聲明，是 John W.Henry 的最高指令。Henry 亦知道，古天奴背傷的掃𣈴結果查出球員並無受傷。而在掃𣈴後兩天，古天奴的代表曾與體育總監愛華士開會，但不歡而散。任何球會東主，如果發現隊中主力在簽約五年後，卻只在自己住所簽了短期租約，相信不難發現背後一定有隱衷。

Hughes 更表示，曾與 John W.Henry 溝通過的人便了解這位美籍班主有時會神龍見首不見尾，一時會極度專注處理一件事，但在別的事上卻可能表示無瑕應付。當然，他身處美國，及擁有多項業務是原中可能，亦是當年為何 Segura 曾一度獲得 Henry 信任，但過了一會卻被投閒置散。

但在古天奴一事上，John W.Henry 卻沒有任何退讓的可能 －尤其轉會窗利物浦的操作並未備球會或球迷感到完全滿意。FSG 希望在古天奴一事上採取強項態度，向隊中球員及其他球員表態：利物浦不是一家 selling club，如果古天奴被售出，利物浦從今以後將不會被認真看待。

原文：http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/liverpool-couldnt-sell-philippe-coutinho-transfer-barcelona-pep-segura-john-w-henry-a7923351.html
